perturbation.original_text: 3. Term of Agreement. This Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall continue until December 31, 2020, unless extended or earlier terminated. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time on prior written notice to the other. This Agreement may be extended upon mutual written agreement of the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Term of Agreement. This Agreement shall begin on the Effective Date and shall continue until December 31, 2020. Either party may terminate this Agreement at any time on thirty (30) days prior written notice to the other. This Agreement may only be extended upon unanimous written agreement of all the parties involved and if a conflict arises the company's decision will be final.
perturbation.explanation: The original states termination can occur with prior written notice without specifying a duration. The modified text introduces a 30-day notice period, creating a contradiction as to the immediate termination clause and creates ambiguity regarding the agreement extension condition.

perturbation.original_text:
4. Confidential Information.

(a) "Confidential Information" means any information, materials or methods in whatever form or embodiment that has not been made available by Aduro to the general public and any information, materials or methods in the possession or control of Consultant on the Effective Date or developed in the performance of the Services, except that Confidential Information shall not include any information, material or method that (i) at the time of disclosure is in, or after disclosure becomes part of the public domain, through no improper act on the part of Consultant or any of its employees; (ii) was in Consultant's possession at the time of disclosure, as shown by written evidence, and was not acquired, directly or indirectly, from work with Aduro; or (iii) Consultant receives from a third party, provided that such Confidential Information was not obtained by such third party, directly or indirectly, from Aduro.
perturbation.changed_text:
4. Confidential Information.

(a) "Confidential Information" means any information, materials or methods in whatever form or embodiment that has not been made available by Aduro to the general public and any information, materials or methods in the possession or control of Consultant on the Effective Date or developed in the performance of the Services. Confidential Information shall not include any information, material or method that (i) at the time of disclosure is in, or after disclosure becomes part of the public domain, through no improper act on the part of Consultant or any of its employees; (ii) was in Consultant's possession at the time of disclosure, as shown by written evidence, and was not acquired, directly or indirectly, from work with Aduro.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Confidential Information' excludes information received from a third party, provided that such third party did not obtain it from Aduro. The modified version removes this exception, creating ambiguity as to whether information received from a third party is considered 'Confidential Information', even if that third party obtained it from Aduro.

perturbation.original_text: 6. Intellectual Property. Aduro shall be the sole and exclusive owner of, and Consultant hereby assigns to Aduro, any and all writings, documents, work product, inventions, developments, improvements, discoveries, know-how, processes, chemical entities, compounds, plans, memoranda, tests, research, designs, specifications, models and data that Consultant makes, conceives, discovers or develops, either solely or jointly with any other person in performance of the Services (collectively, "Work Product"). Consultant shall promptly disclose to Aduro all information relating to Work Product as appropriate as part of the Services and at the request of Aduro. To the extent, if any, that Consultant has rights in or to any Work Product or any data or inventions developed in connection with work under this Agreement ("Aduro IP"), Consultant hereby irrevocably assigns and transfers to Aduro, and to the extent that an executory assignment is not enforceable, Consultant hereby agrees to assign and transfer to Aduro, in writing, from time to time, upon request, any and all right, title, or interest that Consultant has or may obtain in any Work Product and/or Aduro IP without the necessity of further consideration. Aduro shall be entitled to obtain and hold in its own name all copyrights, patents, trade secrets and trademarks with respect thereto. At Aduro's request and expense, Consultant shall assist Aduro in acquiring and maintaining its right in and title to, any Work Product. Such assistance may include, but will not be limited to, signing applications and other documents, cooperating in legal proceedings, and taking any other steps considered necessary or desirable by Aduro.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. Intellectual Property. Aduro shall be the sole and exclusive owner of, and Consultant hereby assigns to Aduro, any and all writings, documents, work product, inventions, developments, improvements, discoveries, know-how, processes, chemical entities, compounds, plans, memoranda, tests, research, designs, specifications, models and data that Consultant makes, conceives, discovers or develops, either solely or jointly with any other person in performance of the Services (collectively, "Work Product"). Consultant shall promptly disclose to Aduro all information relating to Work Product as appropriate as part of the Services and at the request of Aduro. To the extent Consultant has rights in or to any Work Product or any data or inventions developed in connection with work under this Agreement ("Aduro IP"), Consultant retains all rights, titles, or interest that Consultant has or may obtain in any Work Product and/or Aduro IP, unless it is determined by the company at a later date that it will be transferred to Aduro.
perturbation.explanation: The original section states that the consultant irrevocably assigns the rights, titles, and interests to Aduro of the intellectual property. The modified section states that the consultant retains all rights, titles, and interests unless determined by the company at a later date it will be transferred to Aduro. Therefore, there is a contradiction of who owns the rights, titles, and interests of the intellectual property.
